comments.body: Which means that with foo"bar as the only group you will get `"\"foo\\\"bar\""` as output? Would have expected `"foo\"bar". Compare also the test-case below: would have expected `groups=` instead of `groups=""`.

> Which means that with foo"bar as the only group you will get "\"foo\\\"bar\"" as output?

That is the result I expect.  One parsing rule.



> Compare also the test-case below: would have expectedgroups=instead ofgroups=""`.

Also the expected result.  It's a quoted string of quoted strings separated by spaces.  Same as `asgroups` before it.
I don't want to see people using sed or awk to parse these strings :scream:
That's why we need to write that advanced audit ðŸ˜‰

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +117,121 @@		id := uuid.NewRandom().String()

		line := fmt.Sprintf("%s AUDIT: id=%q ip=%q method=%q user=%q groups=%q as=%q asgroups=%q namespace=%q uri=%q\n",
			time.Now().Format(time.RFC3339Nano), id, utilnet.GetClientIP(req), req.Method, attribs.GetUser().GetName(), groups, asuser, asgroups, namespace, req.URL)
		if _, err := fmt.Fprint(out, line); err != nil {
